name: The Crystal Luxury Bay Resort Nusa Dua - Bali
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai Jl. Puri Mumbul Permai No.88, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
review 1: Many parts of the hotel as advertised are run down and closed, although there is a nice well maintained rooftop pool, the bar and restaurant area are closed, the coffee shop in the lobby is also closed. This should be stated in the advertising for the hotel. It is possible to order food for these areas, and it is brought from the kitchen, but missing the personal touch. The good part about this hotel is the size and cleanliness of the rooms. If you are simply looking for a clean place to lay your head you don't need to look any further. Bathrooms were also looking a bit sad, clean though so no hygeine issue, but the taps and fitting in the shower and bath were partially stripped of their chrome finish, presumable because of to harsh cleaning chemical being used at some time in the past. Towels and bathroom supplies were all clean and well presented. Breakfasts were standard, nothing special. What this hotel needs is a good manager, who walks the hotel and directs his staff to do their jobs properly. I pointed out a couple of areas that need the attention of housekeeping, and the issues were swiftly resolved. You will not be getting the full 5 star hotel experience, but the prices being charged reflect that! Just have to add that the desk staff were super attentive and did all they could to make our stay enjoyable. This hotel was built to a high standard, and with a little help and support, It could attain those heights again.
review 2:
AVOID THIS PLACE.
If i could i would give 0 stars to this awful place.
The rooms are dirty and proper old with many broken parts. The sink are rusty and the whole bedroom smells bad with everything falling apart.
The sunbed by the pool is literally rotten , the food is awful and with flies/insects. Staff won‚Äôt help at all. You can ask them for anything and they‚Äôre won‚Äôt even bother to help. The lift smells very bad and it‚Äôs covered in dirt with panels falling apart.
This hotel is a nightmare, literally ruined my stay in Nusa Dua. Avoid avoid avoid .
review 3:
This was our first stay in Bali during our honeymoon and it was the best we found during our entire trip, it was better than the "private villas" we stayed later at. To begin with the staff is courteous, rooms are clean and well maintained, nice rooftop and swimming pool. To add to it, when we requested an early morning packed breakfast (5am) we were delighted to see they providing so many options in the packed breakfast. When they got to know it was our honeymoon they even upgraded us to their signature suite which was icing on the cake. Kudos to the team! And special callout to "Lily" for her fantastic services

- Akash & Nikita
review 4:
Absolutely unworthy. The night view and stay is a nightmare. If you are a vegetarian, then this place is strict NO. Terrible experience with the place. The hotel and live counters are full of flies, rotten food. The swimming pools are not at all maintained well.  If any problem discussed with managemt, they dont respond and do as promised.

Booked through agoda (Agoda preferred property) but very unhelpful.
review 5: The rooms were clean, very comfortable, The breakfast also good with complete menu and the staff was amazing. Darren as DOS are also very helpful, They went over and beyond to help make our stay enjoyable. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Bali.

name: Graha Socio Hotel (Family Hotel)
address: Jalan By Pass Ngurah Rai Jalan Nusa Dua ‚Äì Bandara Ngurah Rai, Toll Road No.87x, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
Absolutely amazing experience!

Originally booked for just a week, we couldn't resist extending our stay to a whole month after falling head over heels for this hotel.

The receptionists, restaurant, cleaning maintenance staff particularly Agu and the restaurant team, were incredibly warm and even took the time to teach us Bahasa. Kudos to Wigi, the hotel manager, for curating such a fantastic team that made us feel right at home.

This hotel seamlessly caters to both travelers and locals alike, making everyone feel welcome.

There's so much more I could say, but time and space are limited.

Highly recommended for families, solo travelers, or anyone seeking a delightful setting with great food and a relaxing swim.

And don't miss the live music every Saturday and Sunday starting at 4pm!
review 2:
I would like to extend my most deepest gratitude and appreciation for the staff in Graha Socio for the wonderful stay and hospitality I have received. The rooms were cleaned up after every night and the staffs were super helpful in their recommendations for food, places to visit, etc.
I would definitely recommend families to come and stay as they have dream-like facilities for the kids; simple yet eventful. Lovely late afternoons seeing these innocent young beings have so much fun definitely warms the heart.
review 3:
It might one of the worst hotel that I ever stay in Bali

- not helpful staff
- no regular TV Channel - use your own Netflix access
- no liquid soap, only 1 small soap bar
- thin wall
- there rat crawling on the roof at night
- no lift and no access way for your luggage bag
- on the 2nd day my breakfast box theres no eggs (not consistent with the 1st day)
review 4:
The room is very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Especially thank you to Dutta. He was very attractive and polite.
See you soon
review 5:
Wifi is not the most consistent, service is amazing and the people are super nice.
The place is quiet.

name: Eighteen Coffee Bali
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai No.74, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
review 1: Owned by Cinta Laura the Indonesian actress the Resto and coffee shop is a chill place with indoor and outdoor space. Great place to work from as well as the WiFi is descent. The food is good, the Oreo cake is amazing. I had the Waghyu rice bowl and was quite delicious. More at @zsoltzsemba
review 2:
Nice place, clean, tidy, comfy
Staff are nice and humble
But sometimes hiding while eating under the table.
Price also reasonable with the taste
review 3:
The cake is really good!
Coffee is not bad ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Took the mushroom soup very tasty.
I wanted to try the New Year's desserts, but at the time there were none, I was very disappointed.
I would say the prices are high.
review 4: I spent almost 6 hours here.. it's THAT cozy. The coffee is 9/10, not too sweet. The lychee drink (I forgot the name) is 1000/10, got recommended by the barista, and I LOVE IT! The almond croissant is 8/10ü´∂
review 5: Cafe and service was okay. I ordered for take away and waited but then they serve it to dine in. Staff was friendly but not very informative and somehow one of them tripped and broke one of the plate/cups and laughed it out. üôÇ

name: MAO JIA CAI
address: Jl.By Pass Ngurahrai no.26 A, Mumbul, Nusa dua,Benoa,Kuta Selatan, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: Food is so good! Love the atmosphere too. The seafood here are excellent! Really recommend to eat here if you love spicy foods!! üíû
review 2:
Taste : a but tasteless for the steam fish but tge fish quality was very good.
Price : a bit too expensive
review 3: Pricing is very unReasonable in contrast with So So Taste.
review 4: Excellent, awesome...love the Hunan food, this dish was their PO Turtle in Jkt China Town Resto. 24hr open.
review 5:
It's good, quiet place but a bit overpriced!
No atmosphere.
But when I came back with my take out order to replace the very spicy dish they replace it with no problem. That is very good sign and they keep they reputation!
Respect that

name: Honey & Bread Cafe
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai No.KM.25, Benoa, Nusa Dua, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
Good place, the cafe is located near the store. Friendly and attentive staff.

Their Indonesian Soto Ayam soup is a real winner - so flavorful and satisfying! They served it with rice on the side, and you can add red pepper for spiciness.

Also you should try their excellent carrot cake with a cup of coffee. It‚Äôs the perfect combination!
review 2: The best place to eat in Bali! Regret not finding it sooner. We had lunch, we returned for breakfast the next day, and we couldn‚Äôt resist another dinner. A culinary paradise within 2 days. Delicious food, plenty of options, affordable prices and generous portions. Thank you
review 3: Recommended! The food tastes great. Wifi and electrical socket are available. Perfect for work or just hangout with friends.
review 4: Great service and coffee whilst you finalise your shopping as it‚Äôs inside Pepito. MD Souiti - thank you for the amazing coffee!!
review 5: Similar to a Starbucks vibe but with better food options. Delicious and medium size portions.

name: GRAHA KITCHEN FAMILY RESTO (kid's Friendly Restaurant)
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai No.87-89, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: Amazing place for kids. The Indonesian food here is so yummy! There's a pool, playground and trampoline. This is the perfect spot to unwind and is close to the Immigration head office. Ask the staff for the special toys locked in a cabinet near the front desk. We spend the whole afternoon here hanging out. The staff were so friendly and we can't stress how good the Indonesian food is!
review 2:
Ribs - good. Nasi goreng - just ok. Coffee - good.
The staff hardly spoke English and was very slow to response.
There is no AC and even in the evening the place was uncomfortably hot.
Some prices in the menu and in their computer are different. Be careful!
review 3: I love this place. Clean, cozy and quiet. Delicious food and cocktails. You can swim in the pool, there is a shower. The service is top, the workers are very attentive and good.
review 4: Had an amazing experience at Graha Kitchen. Amazing food with a good price and good service to, especially Agung. We will definitely come back ü•∞
review 5: Amazing services. Should stay at the hotel for next trips

review 1: It's very noisy, so it prevents visitors of local hotels from sleeping
review 2: The place cause noise pollution on nearby premises till very late of night even during weekday.

name: Warung Babi Guling Buyfast Nusa Dua
address: 6666+3F4, Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: Many locals eat babi guling here which means the food is good. I agree as well. The food tastes great. The pricing is fair for the quality. The interior feels dirty, needs to be cleaner. But that's a normal traditional village-ish kind of restaurant. The taste is however, fantastic. Recommended babi guling restaurant in Nusa Dua area.
review 2: the place little bit small for dine in. but the pork taste is good, food presentation nice

name: Social hotel
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai No.87X, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: this hotel was terrible. while I lived there for a week, twice, at 7 in the morning, unknown men tried to enter my room. the hotel is unsafe. When I asked why strangers calmly enter the hotel through the reception, no one is interested in why they are and where they are going. As a result, unknown local residents almost knocked out the door. They came to me twice through the streets, and no one even asked them where you were going and why. The hotel doesn't care, they tell you, oh sorry, the manager works from 9, but that someone accidentally breaks into the girl's room is normal for them! they were not interested in strange people walking around the hotel who broke into my room. it was a lot of stress! I have never seen this in other hotels. Dangerous! Dangerous! Dangerous! don't stay there! there are also different rules for guests from different countries, if you from Europe treat you worse than guests from their country, they directly say so - they are afraid to take it and say something, although I don‚Äôt recommend making noise every night!

name: Crystaloka Villas
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai No.89, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
After our original wedding organizer has failed to provide us with any decent ideas for wedding reception place and we started looking for a villa that would be a good fit for our 13 people group.

Luckily after searching on Facebook groups manager of this villa (Shelli) has reach out to me. After seeing this villa we decided to go with it.

Shelli has been gone above and beyond with organization for our event. She has been extremely helpful in coordinating with music groups, cook, drivers and our other wedding planner. Every little detail was arranged by her to make sure that everything is exceeding our expectations on our special day.

As for the villa, they have amazing decorations and a great pool. Rooms are really clean and comfortable.
The dinner they served for us was arguably one of the best that can be found in Bali.

Villa team was very friendly and you could feel that they really enjoy what they do.

I strongly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a villa to stay in or to plan an event
review 2: Villa Crystaloka is very satisfying with swimming pool facilities, Slow Music, serving healthy food and beautiful white room facilities...The Best Villa Crystaloka.
review 3: Good for retreat, healing group, and the place where you can find serenity in the town
review 4: Nice villa to stay when you have a holiday in Bali
